<url>http://www.lsoft.com/images/listserv_small.gif</url> </image>   <item rdf:about="https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=ENGINEERING-GEOTECH;500b200e.1503">   <title>FW: Call for Papers-6icragee </title>   <link>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=ENGINEERING-GEOTECH;500b200e.1503</link>   <description> DEAR FRIEND,<br><br>PLEASE MARK YOUR CALENDAR, AND PLAN TO JOIN THIS IMPORTANT CONFERENCE.<br>2. PLEASE LIST THIS ON YOUR WEB SITE FOR ALL TO SHARE.<br>3. IF YOU HAVE ANY QUESTINS, PLEASE ASK ME.<br>LOVE<br><br>Shamsher Prakash<br>Emeritus Professor, MST and PRESIDENT, SP FOUNDATION<br>Distinguished Member, ASCE 227 Civil Engineering Department, MST Rolla, Missouri<br>DISTINGUISHED VISITING PROFESSOR IIT ROORKEE,<br>Home Address: 1707 Jackson Circle Rolla Missouri 65401<br>www.6icragee.com&lt;http://www.6icragee.com/&gt;<br>https//7icchge.mst.edu<br>www.yoga10.org&lt;http://www.yoga10.org/&gt;<br>Email: prakash@mst.edu&lt;mailto:prakash@mst.edu&gt;    </description>   <dc:date>2015-03-03T17:31:04+00:00</dc:date>   <dc:creator>Prakash, Shamsher</dc:creator>   <dc:identifier>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=ENGINEERING-GEOTECH;500b200e.1503</dc:identifier> </item>  <item rdf:about="https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=ENGINEERING-GEOTECH;8fcc123d.1502">   <title>Studentships in Offshore Geotechnical Engineering at Oxford University </title>   <link>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=ENGINEERING-GEOTECH;8fcc123d.1502</link>   <description> Dear Colleagues,<br>We are currently recruiting graduate students in Offshore Geotechnics for our new Centre for Renewable Energy Marine Structures, in collaboration with Cranfield University. We have up to 2 fully funded doctoral studentships in offshore geotechnical engineering available, for a start in October 2015. We are open to applications from those who will complete undergraduate degrees or MSc degrees, or those currently working in industry and looking to develop a career in offshore renewable energy. If this is of interest to you please consider applying, or please forward to anyone you feel might be suitably qualified and interested in [...]    </description>   <dc:date>2015-02-01T13:42:41+00:00</dc:date>   <dc:creator>Byron Byrne</dc:creator>   <dc:identifier>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=ENGINEERING-GEOTECH;8fcc123d.1502</dc:identifier> </item>  <item rdf:about="https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=ENGINEERING-GEOTECH;6977767d.1501">   <title>update on the 'Symposium on Energy Geotechnics\ufffd\ufffd\ufffd, TC308, Barcelona, Spain June 2-4 2015</title>   <link>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=ENGINEERING-GEOTECH;6977767d.1501</link>   <description> Dear Colleagues:<br><br>I am attaching the 2nd announcement related to the Symposium on Energy Geotechnics\ufffd\ufffd\ufffd to be held in Barcelona, Spain, June 2-4, 2015. This event is organized by the TC308 on \ufffd\ufffd\ufffdEnergy Geotechnics\ufffd\ufffd\ufffd<br><br>We are planning a very interesting Symposium including: position papers, several panel discussions, invited papers and technical presentations. Selected papers will be published in the Journal \ufffd\ufffd\ufffdGeomechanics for Energy and Environment\ufffd\ufffd\ufffd. [...]   </description>   <dc:date>2015-01-31T01:16:34+00:00</dc:date>   <dc:creator>Sanchez Castilla, Marcelo Javier</dc:creator>   <dc:identifier>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=ENGINEERING-GEOTECH;6977767d.1501</dc:identifier> </item>  <item rdf:about="https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=ENGINEERING-GEOTECH;76cefe64.1501">   <title>Marie Curie early stage researcher position on unsaturated testing </title>   <link>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=ENGINEERING-GEOTECH;76cefe64.1501</link>   <description> Dear colleagues,<br><br>An 8 months' position is available at the Nottingham Centre for Geomechanics, University of Nottingham on experimental investigation into the behaviour of unsaturated soil. If you happen to know any strong and eligible candidate, could you please pass the information?<br><br>For more details and to apply, please visit http://www.nottingham.ac.uk/jobs/currentvacancies/ref/ENG833<br><br>Best wishes,<br>Xia    </description>   <dc:date>2015-01-30T16:52:58+00:00</dc:date>   <dc:creator>Xia Li</dc:creator>   <dc:identifier>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=ENGINEERING-GEOTECH;76cefe64.1501</dc:identifier> </item>  <item rdf:about="https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=ENGINEERING-GEOTECH;35098f17.1501">   <title>rockmechabnical data of Hunsr\ufffd\ufffdck slate, western GErmany</title>   <link>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=ENGINEERING-GEOTECH;35098f17.1501</link>   <description> Dear group members,<br><br>does anyone has knowledge of rock mechanical data of the Hunsr\ufffd\ufffdck slate in<br>Germany. So far I did not find any data in publications. Of special interest<br>would be cohesion, friction angle and shear strength of discontinuities like<br>cleavage planes for instance.<br>Thanks for any comment.<br>Cheers<br><br>Christian    </description>   <dc:date>2015-01-29T10:18:32+01:00</dc:date>   <dc:creator>Christian Heinz</dc:creator>   <dc:identifier>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=ENGINEERING-GEOTECH;35098f17.1501</dc:identifier> </item>  <item rdf:about="https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=ENGINEERING-GEOTECH;68551847.1501">   <title>Centrifuge Tests </title>   <link>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=ENGINEERING-GEOTECH;68551847.1501</link>   <description> Colleagues<br><br>I have a problem concerning the grinding of debris example rocks in a whirlpool.<br>Could a centrifuge help to model this?<br>At constant speed these rocks get locked.<br>In a whirlpool the orbits are not the same changing with speed and depth.<br><br>Regards,<br><br>Parminder Singh<br>Independent Researcher<br>Malaysia   </description>   <dc:date>2015-01-26T03:31:15+00:00</dc:date>   <dc:creator>Parminder Singh</dc:creator>   <dc:identifier>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=ENGINEERING-GEOTECH;68551847.1501</dc:identifier> </item>  <item rdf:about="https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=ENGINEERING-GEOTECH;650b5e59.1501">   <title>InterPore 2015 (May 18 - 21, 2015, Padova, Italy) </title>   <link>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=ENGINEERING-GEOTECH;650b5e59.1501</link>   <description> Dear colleagues,<br><br>We would like to inform you of InterPore 2015 conference (May 18 - 21, 2015, Padova, Italy).<br><br>https://www.interpore.org/padova<br><br>There are a couple of geomechanical/geotechnical sessions in this conference this year such as:<br><br>------<br><br>MS 1.14.: Unsaturated poromechanics: experimental, theoretical and numerical studies<br><br>Co-chairs: E. Nikooee (Faculty of Geosciences, Utrecht University), S. M. Hassanizadeh (Faculty of Geosciences, Utrecht University), J.-M. Pereira (Laboratoire Navier, Geotechnical Group (CERMES), \ufffd\ufffdcole des Ponts ParisTech),C. Jommi (Faculty of Civil Engineering and Geosciences, TU Delft), and A. Askarinejad (Faculty of Civil Engineering and Geosciences, TU Delft) [...]   </description>   <dc:date>2015-01-22T10:36:44+00:00</dc:date>   <dc:creator>Secretary of the conference</dc:creator>   <dc:identifier>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=ENGINEERING-GEOTECH;650b5e59.1501</dc:identifier> </item>  <item rdf:about="https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=ENGINEERING-GEOTECH;f60adf35.1501">   <title>lowering surface water </title>   <link>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=ENGINEERING-GEOTECH;f60adf35.1501</link>   <description> Dear colleagues<br>We have faced a problem in one of manufacturing sites in South of Iran with ground water. The area of site is about 100 Hectares and there are several underground utility such as cable galleries or utility tunnels. now the water table has increased in higher levels and all UG facilities are in danger of collapsing. is there any similar experience to come the water lower in level in such vast area? geotechnical investigations has revealed that there is a marl stone layer in the approximate depth of 5 meters which does not allow surface water to penetrate [...]   </description>   <dc:date>2015-01-15T07:25:58+00:00</dc:date>   <dc:creator>Cyrus Jedari</dc:creator>   <dc:identifier>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=ENGINEERING-GEOTECH;f60adf35.1501</dc:identifier> </item>  <item rdf:about="https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=ENGINEERING-GEOTECH;8513db8a.1501">   <title>PhD opportunity at University of Dundee </title>   <link>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=ENGINEERING-GEOTECH;8513db8a.1501</link>   <description> Dear Colleagues,<br><br>Applications are currently open for a funded PhD studentship in the cross-over area of geotechnical engineering and plant science looking at: &quot;Predicting anchorage strength of nodal-root ideotypes to enable selection of lodging-resistant high-yielding cereal varieties.&quot;<br><br>http://www.abdn.ac.uk/clsm/graduate/research/highyielding-cereal-839.php<br><br>(Closing deadline: 20 February 2015)<br><br>Although this has a very 'biological' title, this will involve applying geotechnical physical modelling techniques to the study of soil-structure interaction between the complex root systems of cereal crops and soil, with the aim of identifying optimal root structures (and therefore crop varieties or potential genetic modifications) for high yield crops that would make them more resistant [...]    </description>   <dc:date>2015-01-08T17:16:56+00:00</dc:date>   <dc:creator>Jonathan Knappett (Staff)</dc:creator>   <dc:identifier>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=ENGINEERING-GEOTECH;8513db8a.1501</dc:identifier> </item>  <item rdf:about="https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=ENGINEERING-GEOTECH;86fcc74c.1501">   <title>Re: Weight of Piles </title>   <link>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=ENGINEERING-GEOTECH;86fcc74c.1501</link>   <description> Hi again,<br><br>In order to inspect the grouted area, what do u think of using<br>geophysics method such as 1) crossing a hole beside the pile and<br>measuring velocity or 2)using Pile integrity testing? Other new methods<br>exists but cost much, e.g., TIP (thermal analysis).<br><br>Regards,<br><br>---<br><br>Ehsan Seyedi Hosseininia   </description>   <dc:date>2015-01-08T11:29:29+03:30</dc:date>   <dc:creator>Ehsan Seyedi Hosseininia</dc:creator>   <dc:identifier>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=ENGINEERING-GEOTECH;86fcc74c.1501</dc:identifier> </item>  <item rdf:about="https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=ENGINEERING-GEOTECH;7080ecea.1501">   <title>Re: Weight of Piles </title>   <link>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=ENGINEERING-GEOTECH;7080ecea.1501</link>   <description> Hi Ehsan,<br><br>With suction caissons often the gap between the soil and the lid is<br>grouted.<br>It is difficult to inspect the grouting and the reason I asked if adding an<br>overburden is a better way to ensure the<br>integrity of the foundation.<br><br>Parminder<br><br>On Thu, Jan 8, 2015 at 1:59 AM, Ehsan Seyedi Hosseininia &lt;eseyedi@um.ac.ir&gt;<br>wrote:<br><br>&gt; Dear Prof. Singh,<br>&gt;<br>&gt; To me, the soil inside the pile (pipe pile) should be engaged with the<br>&gt; pile wall. What i mean, is the difference between the soil that is pluged<br>> in the soil or it is not [...]   </description>   <dc:date>2015-01-08T14:53:35+08:00</dc:date>   <dc:creator>Parminder Singh</dc:creator>   <dc:identifier>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=ENGINEERING-GEOTECH;7080ecea.1501</dc:identifier> </item>  <item rdf:about="https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=ENGINEERING-GEOTECH;3d988ca0.1501">   <title>Re: Weight of Piles </title>   <link>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=ENGINEERING-GEOTECH;3d988ca0.1501</link>   <description> Dear Prof. Singh,<br><br>To me, the soil inside the pile (pipe pile) should be engaged with the<br>pile wall. What i mean, is the difference between the soil that is<br>pluged in the soil or it is not pluged. In the case of having no plug in<br>the pile, the soil inside the pile is useless, i think. [...]   </description>   <dc:date>2015-01-07T21:29:04+03:30</dc:date>   <dc:creator>Ehsan Seyedi Hosseininia</dc:creator>   <dc:identifier>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=ENGINEERING-GEOTECH;3d988ca0.1501</dc:identifier> </item>  <item rdf:about="https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=ENGINEERING-GEOTECH;e355a4b4.1501">   <title>FW: PhD project at the British Geological Survey and University of Lancaster </title>   <link>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=ENGINEERING-GEOTECH;e355a4b4.1501</link>   <description> Apologies for the repeat posting, funding and application details are now included.<br><br>If you know of any students who might be interested in a PhD based on inversion of timelapse geoelectrical monitoring data from landslides and engineered slopes, please could you pass on the details of the project below?<br><br>Please note that funding is available for UK/EU applicants and details of how to apply can be found on the Envision website [...]    </description>   <dc:date>2015-01-07T11:59:57+00:00</dc:date>   <dc:creator>Wilkinson, Paul B.</dc:creator>   <dc:identifier>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=ENGINEERING-GEOTECH;e355a4b4.1501</dc:identifier> </item>  <item rdf:about="https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=ENGINEERING-GEOTECH;355fc8cd.1501">   <title>PhD project at the British Geological Survey and University of Lancaster </title>   <link>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=ENGINEERING-GEOTECH;355fc8cd.1501</link>   <description> If you know of any students who might be interested in a PhD based on inversion of timelapse geoelectrical monitoring data from landslides and engineered slopes, please could you pass on the details of the project below?<br><br>British Geological Survey/Lancaster University PhD studentship<br>&quot;New geophysical approaches for monitoring landslides in safety-critical slopes&quot;<br>http://www.envision-dtp.org/portal/projects/002316/new-geophysical-approaches-for-monitoring-landslides-in-safety-critical-slopes<br>Closing date: 15 January 2015<br>Start date: October 2015 [...]    </description>   <dc:date>2015-01-07T11:14:36+00:00</dc:date>   <dc:creator>Wilkinson, Paul B.</dc:creator>   <dc:identifier>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=ENGINEERING-GEOTECH;355fc8cd.1501</dc:identifier> </item>  <item rdf:about="https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=ENGINEERING-GEOTECH;9fca670.1501">   <title>Weight of Piles </title>   <link>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=ENGINEERING-GEOTECH;9fca670.1501</link>   <description> Hi<br><br>Increasing weight of piles increases the bearing capacity but it is not cheap.<br>Hollow or open-ended piles could reduce costs.<br>Adding an overburden on the top and around the edges e.g. imported soil or rock, could this be another way?<br>If the dominating load is lateral say an offshore wind turbine foundation e.g. a monopile or suction pile/caisson,<br>any problems with the overburden. Any thoughts. [...]   </description>   <dc:date>2015-01-07T04:31:58+00:00</dc:date>   <dc:creator>Parminder Singh</dc:creator>   <dc:identifier>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=ENGINEERING-GEOTECH;9fca670.1501</dc:identifier> </item>  <item rdf:about="https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=ENGINEERING-GEOTECH;a2d420c5.1501">   <title>Appreciation </title>   <link>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=ENGINEERING-GEOTECH;a2d420c5.1501</link>   <description> \ufffd\ufffd Dear colleagues,I would like to thank you foryour kind helps. So, I am writing to express my appreciation for your accurate andhelpful comments\ufffd\ufffdabout evaluation of bearing capacity of piles in c-phi soilmaterials.   </description>   <dc:date>2015-01-04T11:08:10+00:00</dc:date>   <dc:creator>yadolah pashang pisheh</dc:creator>   <dc:identifier>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=ENGINEERING-GEOTECH;a2d420c5.1501</dc:identifier> </item>  <item rdf:about="https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=ENGINEERING-GEOTECH;6f00cc81.1412">   <title>Re: Bearing capacity of a single pile in the mixed soil </title>   <link>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=ENGINEERING-GEOTECH;6f00cc81.1412</link>   <description> Dear all,<br>it seems to me that you are assuming that c and phi are soil properties,<br>in the sense they berlong to the soil..<br>This is absolutely not the case;<br>c and phi are parameters of a model and each model works well under<br>certain conditions and does not work under other conditions.<br>Are you sure the c and phi model works well to predict the bearing<br>capacity of piles.?? Regardless the construction procedure?<br>There are no c and phi soils, there are no c soils nor phi soils.<br>The behaviour of some soils in some problems is well [...]    </description>   <dc:date>2014-12-26T12:34:37+01:00</dc:date>   <dc:creator>Giovanni Bosco</dc:creator>   <dc:identifier>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=ENGINEERING-GEOTECH;6f00cc81.1412</dc:identifier> </item>  <item rdf:about="https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=ENGINEERING-GEOTECH;d4464601.1412">   <title>Re: Bearing capacity of a single pile in the mixed soil </title>   <link>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=ENGINEERING-GEOTECH;d4464601.1412</link>   <description> Dear Dr Fakharian,<br><br>May I share the following comments.<br><br>1- As all geotechnical engineers know, conventional bearing capacity<br>equations have inherent difficulties for piles. For example, it is known<br>that end-bearing capacity and skin friction are not independent. In<br>addition, soil parameters are changed during pile construction. None of<br>such phenomena are considered in conventional formulas. [...]   </description>   <dc:date>2014-12-26T13:55:58+03:30</dc:date>   <dc:creator>Ali Fakher</dc:creator>   <dc:identifier>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=ENGINEERING-GEOTECH;d4464601.1412</dc:identifier> </item>  <item rdf:about="https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=ENGINEERING-GEOTECH;877114fc.1412">   <title>Re: Bearing capacity of a single pile in the mixed soil </title>   <link>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=ENGINEERING-GEOTECH;877114fc.1412</link>   <description> Dr. Pashang Pisheh<br><br>Similar to shallow foundations, there are methods to handle the situations that the pile tip is embedded in c-phi soils. You could see, for example Vesic and Janbu methods. Also Kulhawy in the case of bored piles. The ultimate bearing capacity relation in the mentioned methods includes both Nc and Nq factors. Nc and Nq are functions of phi. Also c is applied to Nc, therefore c-phi contributions are both incorporated in the capacity prediction. [...]   </description>   <dc:date>2014-12-26T10:19:58+03:30</dc:date>   <dc:creator>Kazem Fakharian</dc:creator>   <dc:identifier>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=ENGINEERING-GEOTECH;877114fc.1412</dc:identifier> </item>  <item rdf:about="https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=ENGINEERING-GEOTECH;e3b046ed.1412">   <title>Fwd: Re: Bearing capacity of a single pile in the mixed soil </title>   <link>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=ENGINEERING-GEOTECH;e3b046ed.1412</link>   <description> I forgot to mention that in the case of superposition, the result is<br>conservative and thus, there is no concern about the bearng capacity.<br><br>Good Luck<br><br>-------- Original Message --------<br><br>SUBJECT:<br>Re: Bearing capacity of a single pile in the mixed soil<br><br>DATE:<br>2014-12-26 08:23<br><br>FROM:<br>Ehsan Seyedi Hosseininia &lt;eseyedi@um.ac.ir&gt;<br><br>TO:<br>ENGINEERING GEOTECH &lt;ENGINEERING-GEOTECH@jiscmail.ac.uk&gt;<br><br>Dear Yadollah,<br><br>Since the bearing capacity equations are based on limit equilibrium<br>analysis and the principle of superposition is applied, u can do so and<br>sum different terms. [...]   </description>   <dc:date>2014-12-26T08:25:16+03:30</dc:date>   <dc:creator>Ehsan Seyedi Hosseininia</dc:creator>   <dc:identifier>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=ENGINEERING-GEOTECH;e3b046ed.1412</dc:identifier> </item>  <item rdf:about="https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=ENGINEERING-GEOTECH;7ecc517a.1412">   <title>Re: Bearing capacity of a single pile in the mixed soil </title>   <link>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=ENGINEERING-GEOTECH;7ecc517a.1412</link>   <description> Dear Yadollah,<br><br>Since the bearing capacity equations are based on limit equilibrium<br>analysis and the principle of superposition is applied, u can do so and<br>sum different terms.<br><br>Regards,<br>---<br><br>Ehsan Seyedi Hosseininia   </description>   <dc:date>2014-12-26T08:23:07+03:30</dc:date>   <dc:creator>Ehsan Seyedi Hosseininia</dc:creator>   <dc:identifier>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=ENGINEERING-GEOTECH;7ecc517a.1412</dc:identifier> </item>  <item rdf:about="https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=ENGINEERING-GEOTECH;bbd92766.1412">   <title>Bearing capacity of a single pile in the mixed soil </title>   <link>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=ENGINEERING-GEOTECH;bbd92766.1412</link>   <description> Dear colleagues,<br><br>According to the references such as Das, NAVFAC, \ufffd\ufffd\ufffd the formulation used for evaluation of bearing capacity of single piles is based on two categories: for granular soils (c=0) or cohesive soils (fi=0). Now, for a mixed soil, i.e. c and fi not equal to zero, can we combine the bearing capacity resulted from granular and cohesive soil formulation (i.e. : Qtotal = Qgranular+Qcohesive)? [...]   </description>   <dc:date>2014-12-25T17:07:19+00:00</dc:date>   <dc:creator>Yadolah Pashang Pisheh</dc:creator>   <dc:identifier>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=ENGINEERING-GEOTECH;bbd92766.1412</dc:identifier> </item>  <item rdf:about="https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=ENGINEERING-GEOTECH;8f7cbb11.1412">   <title>EMiT: Emerging Technology Conference 2015 </title>   <link>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=ENGINEERING-GEOTECH;8f7cbb11.1412</link>   <description> Apologies to those who this does not interest, but I thought some on this list might find an upcoming conference being held in Manchester next year of interest:<br><br>The organising committee of EMiT 2014 would like to invite you to the next Emerging Technology 'EMiT' conference to be held on 30th June and 1st July 2015 in Manchester. [...]    </description>   <dc:date>2014-12-18T10:41:22+00:00</dc:date>   <dc:creator>Stephen Longshaw</dc:creator>   <dc:identifier>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=ENGINEERING-GEOTECH;8f7cbb11.1412</dc:identifier> </item>  <item rdf:about="https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=ENGINEERING-GEOTECH;b18c9179.1412">   <title>PhD position funded by ANDRA (French national radioactive waste management agency) </title>   <link>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=ENGINEERING-GEOTECH;b18c9179.1412</link>   <description> Dear Colleagues<br><br>Please find attached the advert of a PhD position available at the<br>Universit\ufffd\ufffd de Pau et des Pays de l'Adour in France. The PhD is in<br>collaboration with ANDRA, the French national radioactive waste<br>management agency.<br><br>I would be grateful if you could forward this message to any of your<br>students/colleagues who might be potentially interested and who fulfils<br>the eligibility requirements. Apologies for cross-posting. [...]    </description>   <dc:date>2014-12-15T14:42:32+01:00</dc:date>   <dc:creator>Domenico Gallipoli</dc:creator>   <dc:identifier>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=ENGINEERING-GEOTECH;b18c9179.1412</dc:identifier> </item>  <item rdf:about="https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=ENGINEERING-GEOTECH;b5197740.1412">   <title>PhD in experimental geomechanics at Chalmers </title>   <link>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=ENGINEERING-GEOTECH;b5197740.1412</link>   <description> Dear all,<br><br>Associate Professor Jelke Dijkstra at Chalmers University of Technology is looking for a PhD student to look into micro structural changes of natural clay using advanced imaging methods on 'wet' samples. The main focus is on getting some experimental cells working at a small scale that can test the material along the relevant stress paths and where we can get an 'undisturbed' sample to start with (dealing with wall friction effects). Recently, we acquired new equipment that will make this more attainable (microfluidic pumps, 3D printer). [...]   </description>   <dc:date>2014-12-08T13:20:02+00:00</dc:date>   <dc:creator>Minna Karstunen</dc:creator>   <dc:identifier>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=ENGINEERING-GEOTECH;b5197740.1412</dc:identifier> </item>   </rdf:RDF>
